projects.name: Interpretable Finite State Machine Controller: A Case Study on Lane Merge Yield Mode
projects.summary: This work proposes a multi-mode Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC) system, incorporating a merge yield mode using a Finite State Machine (FSM), to enhance safety and comfort in traffic flow, validated through simulations and open-road testing.

projects.name: Improving Dynamic Wireless Charging System Performance For Electric Vehicles Through Variable Speed Limit Control Integration
projects.summary: This paper proposes combining dynamic wireless charging with Variable Speed Limit (VSL) control to enhance Electric Vehicle (EV) charging efficiency and traffic safety, validated through microscopic traffic simulations showing improved charging system performance and smoother traffic flow.

projects.name: Reinforcement Learning with Communication Latency with Application to Stop-and-Go Wave Dissipation
projects.summary: This work tests the influence of communication and processing latency on traffic wave dissipation control using Connected and Automated Vehicles (CAVs), demonstrating that reinforcement learning controllers maintain performance with latencies of 1 second or less, while non-reinforcement learning controllers rapidly deteriorate.

projects.name: Runtime Monitoring of Accidents in Driving Recordings with Multi-type Logic in Empirical Models
projects.summary: This work proposes a system to detect accidents in dashcam videos using vision-based algorithms, contextual abstraction, and runtime supervision, leveraging pre-trained models like YOLOv3 and DenseNet-201, and employing Higher Order Logic (HOL) and Signal Temporal Logic (STL) for improved anomaly detection.

projects.name: Robustness Verification for Knowledge-Based Logic of Risky Driving Scenes
projects.summary: This project extracts human-understandable logic defining risky driving behaviors from large-scale public transportation accident datasets using tree-based models, and verified model robustness under various parameter combinations to assess resilience to perturbations.

projects.name: Using Automated Vehicle Data as a Fitness Tracker for Sustainability
projects.summary: This work leverages on-board vehicle data from advanced driver assistance systems to provide trip summaries that help drivers understand and improve their driving habits for better sustainability, similar to fitness tracking apps using smart devices, without requiring additional sensors.

projects.name: News Recommendation System
projects.summary: This work utilizes a dataset of over 210,000 HuffPost news headlines (2012-2022), this project employed NLP methods for data preprocessing and implemented recommendation models, finding that collaborative filtering models (XGBRegressor and KNN) outperformed a content-based neural network model in MSE and RMSE metrics.

projects.name: Analyzing Fairness in Medical Image Representations
projects.summary: This project proposes a novel solution to analyze unfairness in medical diagnosis using pre-trained deep learning algorithms (ResNet-18 and Visual Transformers), demonstrating that image representations contain sensitive information about patients' age and gender in the COVID-CT-MD and PAPILA datasets.

projects.name: CPS-VO and S&CC-VO Development and Management
projects.summary: This project involves user cases design and function development for CPS-VO and S&CC-VO using UML and Drupal, and organizes virtual conferences by managing invited PIs, sending invitations, and tracking registration and attendance.

projects.name: IPO Reports Analysis based on Text Data Mining
projects.summary: This work deploys models to predict whether IPOs in China's A-share market would drop below their issue price immediately after issuance, using text and financial data from approximately 2,300 samples, achieving a classification accuracy of 95.83%.
